required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: CELLO - CLiRpath® Excimer Laser System to Enlarge Lumen Openings
clinical_study.official_title: CLiRpath® Excimer Laser System to Enlarge Lumen Openings

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to evaluate the safety and efficacy of the CLiRpath® Photoablation Atherectomy System consisting of the Bias Sheath guiding catheter, in combination with the available CLiRpath® Excimer Laser Catheters ≤ 2.0 mm, to create larger lumens for treatment within the superficial femoral and popliteal arteries above the knee.

primary_outcome.description: The primary efficacy endpoint is laser success, defined as achieving >/= 20% average reduction in the percent (%) diameter stenosis, post-laser and prior to adjunctive therapy, based on angiographic core laboratory assessment.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From discharge through the 6 month follow-up
primary_outcome.description: The primary safety endpoint is the occurrence of major adverse events defined as clinical perforation, major dissection requiring surgery, major amputation, cerebrovascular accidents (CVA), myocardial infarction, and death.

secondary_outcome.description: Acute procedural success, defined as achievement of </= 30% final residual stenosis, as visually assessed by angiography after all adjunctive treatment(s) deemed necessary by the treating physician. Measures % of patients who achieved a final residual stenosis of </=30%.
Minimum and maximum lumen diameters immediately after treatment with the CLiRpath® Photoablation Atherectomy System as determined by Intravascular Ultrasound (IVUS).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: measured post discharge thorugh 12 Months follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical success, defined as primary patency (≤ 50% stenosis at the treatment site), as assessed by duplex Doppler ultrasound at 30 days, six (6) months and 12 months post-procedure

Incidence of freedom from assisted primary patency at 30 days, six (6) and 12 months post-procedure, defined as a re-intervention of a stenosis (patent vessel) at the treatment site to prevent reocclusion
Incidence of freedom from assisted secondary patency at 30 days, six (6) and 12 months post-procedure, defined as a re-intervention of a reocclusion (non-patent vessel) at the treatment site

secondary_outcome.measure: Patients With >50% Stenosis Measured by Duplex Ultrasound
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of patients with >50% stenosis at each follow-up (30 days, six months, and 12 months post-procedure).
Rutherford Classification at 30 days, six (6) and 12 months post-procedure. Physician assessed based on ankle pressures and treadmill testing. Rutherford scale: 0=best, 6=worst
Adverse events during procedure and prior to release from the hospital, at 30 days, six (6) months, and 12 months post-procedure.

Volumetric plaque reduction immediately after treatment with the CLiRpath® Photoablation Atherectomy System as determined by IVUS. Actual volume of plaque present is presented for each measurement point.

intervention.description: Use of CLiRpath Laser Catheter to improve vessel lumen diameter.

overall_official.affiliation: Pinnacle Health Hospital, Central Pennsylvania Research Foundation

responsible_party.organization: Pinnacle Health Hospital, Central Pennsylvania Research Foundation

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Patients were recruited from investigator patient referral base. Recruitment occurred between November 2006 and March 2007
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Patients were screened for inclusion/exclusion criteria

outcome.title: Laser Success
outcome.description: The primary efficacy endpoint is laser success, defined as achieving >/= 20% average reduction in the percent (%) diameter stenosis, post-laser and prior to adjunctive therapy, based on angiographic core laboratory assessment.

measure.title: Laser Success
measure.description: The primary efficacy endpoint is laser success, defined as achieving >/= 20% average reduction in the percent (%) diameter stenosis, post-laser and prior to adjunctive therapy, based on angiographic core laboratory assessment.

analysis.groups_desc: Comparing to an expected value of 20% reduction from initial to post-laser

outcome.title: Major Adverse Events
outcome.description: The primary safety endpoint is the occurrence of major adverse events defined as clinical perforation, major dissection requiring surgery, major amputation, cerebrovascular accidents (CVA), myocardial infarction, and death.
outcome.time_frame: From discharge through the 6 month follow-up

measure.title: Major Adverse Events
measure.description: The primary safety endpoint is the occurrence of major adverse events defined as clinical perforation, major dissection requiring surgery, major amputation, cerebrovascular accidents (CVA), myocardial infarction, and death.

outcome.title: Procedural Success
outcome.description: Acute procedural success, defined as achievement of </= 30% final residual stenosis, as visually assessed by angiography after all adjunctive treatment(s) deemed necessary by the treating physician. Measures % of patients who achieved a final residual stenosis of </=30%.

measure.title: Procedural Success
measure.description: Acute procedural success, defined as achievement of </= 30% final residual stenosis, as visually assessed by angiography after all adjunctive treatment(s) deemed necessary by the treating physician. Measures % of patients who achieved a final residual stenosis of </=30%.

outcome.title: Minimum and Maximum Lumen Diameters
outcome.description: Minimum and maximum lumen diameters immediately after treatment with the CLiRpath® Photoablation Atherectomy System as determined by Intravascular Ultrasound (IVUS).

measure.title: Minimum and Maximum Lumen Diameters
measure.description: Minimum and maximum lumen diameters immediately after treatment with the CLiRpath® Photoablation Atherectomy System as determined by Intravascular Ultrasound (IVUS).

class.title: Post pilot channel max lumen diameter
Post pilot channel min lumen diameter

outcome.title: Clinical Success
outcome.description: Clinical success, defined as primary patency (≤ 50% stenosis at the treatment site), as assessed by duplex Doppler ultrasound at 30 days, six (6) months and 12 months post-procedure
outcome.time_frame: measured post discharge thorugh 12 Months follow-up
outcome.population: 65 patients at 30 days; 59 at 6 months; 46 at 12 months

measure.title: Clinical Success
measure.description: Clinical success, defined as primary patency (≤ 50% stenosis at the treatment site), as assessed by duplex Doppler ultrasound at 30 days, six (6) months and 12 months post-procedure
measure.population: 65 patients at 30 days; 59 at 6 months; 46 at 12 months

outcome.title: Assisted Primary Patency
outcome.description: Incidence of freedom from assisted primary patency at 30 days, six (6) and 12 months post-procedure, defined as a re-intervention of a stenosis (patent vessel) at the treatment site to prevent reocclusion
outcome.population: 65 at 30 days; 64 at 6 months; 63 at 12 months

measure.title: Assisted Primary Patency
measure.description: Incidence of freedom from assisted primary patency at 30 days, six (6) and 12 months post-procedure, defined as a re-intervention of a stenosis (patent vessel) at the treatment site to prevent reocclusion
measure.population: 65 at 30 days; 64 at 6 months; 63 at 12 months
measure.units: % pts free from assisted primary patency

outcome.title: Assisted Secondary Patency
outcome.description: Incidence of freedom from assisted secondary patency at 30 days, six (6) and 12 months post-procedure, defined as a re-intervention of a reocclusion (non-patent vessel) at the treatment site
outcome.population: 65 at 30 days; 64 at 6 months; 63 at 12 months

measure.title: Assisted Secondary Patency
measure.description: Incidence of freedom from assisted secondary patency at 30 days, six (6) and 12 months post-procedure, defined as a re-intervention of a reocclusion (non-patent vessel) at the treatment site
measure.population: 65 at 30 days; 64 at 6 months; 63 at 12 months

outcome.title: Patients With >50% Stenosis Measured by Duplex Ultrasound
outcome.description: Percentage of patients with >50% stenosis at each follow-up (30 days, six months, and 12 months post-procedure).
outcome.population: per protocol; 65 patients at 30 days; 59 at 6 months and 46 at 12 months

measure.title: Patients With >50% Stenosis Measured by Duplex Ultrasound
measure.description: Percentage of patients with >50% stenosis at each follow-up (30 days, six months, and 12 months post-procedure).
measure.population: per protocol; 65 patients at 30 days; 59 at 6 months and 46 at 12 months

outcome.title: Walking Impairment Questionare (WIQ)
outcome.description: Measures difficulty in walking before and after treatment. Defined by comparing the responses to a WIQ at pre-treatment with the responses at 30 days, six (6) months and 12 months post-procedure. Higher score is better (scale 0-100).
outcome.population: 65 patients at baseline and 30 days; 64 at 6 mo; 63 at 12 mo

measure.title: Walking Impairment Questionare (WIQ)
measure.description: Measures difficulty in walking before and after treatment. Defined by comparing the responses to a WIQ at pre-treatment with the responses at 30 days, six (6) months and 12 months post-procedure. Higher score is better (scale 0-100).
measure.population: 65 patients at baseline and 30 days; 64 at 6 mo; 63 at 12 mo

outcome.title: Rutherford Classification
outcome.description: Rutherford Classification at 30 days, six (6) and 12 months post-procedure. Physician assessed based on ankle pressures and treadmill testing. Rutherford scale: 0=best, 6=worst
outcome.population: 63 at baseline; 62 at 30days and 6 months; 63 at 12 months

measure.title: Rutherford Classification
measure.description: Rutherford Classification at 30 days, six (6) and 12 months post-procedure. Physician assessed based on ankle pressures and treadmill testing. Rutherford scale: 0=best, 6=worst
measure.population: 63 at baseline; 62 at 30days and 6 months; 63 at 12 months

outcome.title: Adverse Events
outcome.description: Adverse events during procedure and prior to release from the hospital, at 30 days, six (6) months, and 12 months post-procedure.

measure.title: Adverse Events
measure.description: Adverse events during procedure and prior to release from the hospital, at 30 days, six (6) months, and 12 months post-procedure.

outcome.title: Volumetric Plaque Reduction
outcome.description: Volumetric plaque reduction immediately after treatment with the CLiRpath® Photoablation Atherectomy System as determined by IVUS. Actual volume of plaque present is presented for each measurement point.

measure.title: Volumetric Plaque Reduction
measure.description: Volumetric plaque reduction immediately after treatment with the CLiRpath® Photoablation Atherectomy System as determined by IVUS. Actual volume of plaque present is presented for each measurement point.

event.sub_title: Right renal artery and non-treated leg stenosis
Occlusion to treated leg other than at lesion site

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
